About Me

I am an undergraduate student at Brown University studying Mathematics-Computer Science and Engineering. As a student researcher and advocate, I‚Äôm excited about anything broadly related to alignment, technical AI governance, and complex systems.

When probing into theories that configures higher-level design and policy decisions, I‚Äôm also making my way to explore downstream, grassroots solutions that center community-driven technologies.

My Work

Here is a list of selected projects:

  • Automated Benchmark for Overton Pluralistic Alignment, in collaboration with Elinor Poole-Dayan et al., advised by Michiel Bakker
  • Toward Deliverer-Centered Food Delivery Algorithmic Management: Cross-Platforms Case Studies, Computational Approaches, and Regulatory Alternatives [Preprint][Project Repository], advised by Harini Suresh at The Data in Society Collective (DISCO Lab)
  • Algorithmic (AI/ML) Fairness Research for Socially Responsible Computing (SRC) Handbook [Handbook], advised by Suresh Venkatasubramanian and Julia Netter at Brown Uiversity Department of Computer Science and Center for Technology Responsibility (CNTR)
  • Agent City Hall: Capturing and Replicating Human Thought Processes, Opinions, and Sentiments in Response to Rezoning/Position: Simulating Society Requires Simulating Thought [Preprint], in collaboration with Chance Jiajie Li et al.

Misc

I work for/with a range of organizations and initiatives including HOPE Academy, Period Pride, Housing Opportunities for People Everywhere (also HOPE!), some labor data advocacies, etc. In my spare time, I enjoyed taking on plank challenges (7min+) and roaming around residential urban villages (Guangzhou/Shanghai), where I lived and volunteeredüè† ;‚Äù)
